title: Bernhard Bieri's personal package with a set of miscellaneous functions
text: ggplot2 graphing function inspired updated great package.
code: library(HohgantR) HohgantR::indicators_long |> dplyr::filter(indicator == "Indicator") |> # Filter by indicator if necessary ggslope(year, value, unit)  # Plot things

title: Bernhard Bieri's personal package with a set of miscellaneous functions
text: ggplot2 theme Bernie’s blog.
code: library(HohgantR) library(tidyverse) #> Warning in Sys.timezone(): unable to identify current timezone 'C': #> please set environment variable 'TZ' # Prepare data cty_mpg <- aggregate(mpg$cty, by = list(mpg$manufacturer), FUN = mean) colnames(cty_mpg) <- c("make", "mileage") # change column names cty_mpg <- cty_mpg[order(cty_mpg$mileage), ] # sort cty_mpg$make <- factor(cty_mpg$make, levels = cty_mpg$make) # Plot ggplot(cty_mpg, aes(x = make, y = mileage)) +   geom_segment(aes(     x = make,     xend = make,     y = 0,     yend = mileage   ), color = "white") +   geom_point(size = 3, color = "orange") +   labs(     title = "Lollipop Chart",     subtitle = "Make Vs Avg. Mileage",     caption = "source: mpg"   ) +   HohgantR::themebernie() +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 65, vjust = 0.6))

title: Bernhard Bieri's personal package with a set of miscellaneous functions
text: ggplot2 theme inspired minerals.
code: library(HohgantR) library(tidyverse) # Prepare data cty_mpg <- aggregate(mpg$cty, by = list(mpg$manufacturer), FUN = mean) colnames(cty_mpg) <- c("make", "mileage") # change column names cty_mpg <- cty_mpg[order(cty_mpg$mileage), ] # sort cty_mpg$make <- factor(cty_mpg$make, levels = cty_mpg$make) # Plot ggplot(cty_mpg, aes(x = make, y = mileage)) +   geom_segment(aes(     x = make,     xend = make,     y = 0,     yend = mileage   ), color = "white") +   geom_point(size = 3, color = "#C3CED6") +   labs(     title = "Lollipop Chart",     subtitle = "Make Vs Avg. Mileage",     caption = "source: mpg"   ) +   HohgantR::thememineral() +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 65, vjust = 0.6))

title: Slope graph for ggplot2 — ggslope
text: Creates slope graph ideal use computing changes one indicators waves survey time series data low number periods.

title: Slope graph for ggplot2 — ggslope
code: ggslope(   data,   x,   y,   group,   DataLabel = NULL,   title = "No title given",   subtitle = "No subtitle given",   caption = "No caption given",   LineThickness = 1,   LineColor = "ByGroup",   DataTextSize = 2.5,   DataTextColor = "black",   DataLabelPadding = 0.05,   DataLabelLineSize = 0,   DataLabelFillColor = "#f5f5f2",   WiderLabels = FALSE,   ReverseYAxis = FALSE,   ReverseXAxis = FALSE,   RemoveMissing = TRUE )

title: Slope graph for ggplot2 — ggslope
text: Adapted updated great package.

title: Slope graph for ggplot2 — ggslope
text: data Data frame containing data long form. Required input. x variable x axis, usually time, survey wave, etc. Required input. y variable y axis, usually indicator poverty inequality measures. Required input. group Grouping variable showing various levels indicator. DataLabel Data label title Plot title subtitle Plot subtitle caption Plot caption LineThickness Line width LineColor Line color DataTextSize Text size data point value. DataTextColor Text color data point value. DataLabelPadding Text padding label level. DataLabelLineSize Text label line size. DataLabelFillColor Text label fill color. WiderLabels Set wider labels? False default. ReverseYAxis Revert Y axis? False default. ReverseXAxis Revert X axis? False default. RemoveMissing Remove missing values? True default.

title: Slope graph for ggplot2 — ggslope
text: pretty slope graph.

title:
Bernie's theme for ggplot 2 blog graphs. Inspired by the excellent
{hrbrthemes} package. — themebernie
code: # \donttest{  library(ggplot2)  # Prepare data  cty_mpg <- aggregate(mpg$cty, by=list(mpg$manufacturer), FUN=mean)  # aggregate  colnames(cty_mpg) <- c("make", "mileage")  # change column names  cty_mpg <- cty_mpg[order(cty_mpg$mileage), ]  # sort  cty_mpg$make <- factor(cty_mpg$make, levels = cty_mpg$make)  # Plot  ggplot(cty_mpg, aes(x=make, y=mileage)) +    geom_segment(aes(x=make,                     xend=make,                     y=0,                     yend=mileage), color = "white") +    geom_point(size=3, color = "orange") +    labs(title="Lollipop Chart",         subtitle="Make Vs Avg. Mileage",         caption="source: mpg") +    HohgantR::themebernie() +    theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle=65, vjust=0.6))   # }

title: Mineral theme for ggplot 2 graphs — thememineral
code: # \donttest{  library(ggplot2)  # Prepare data  cty_mpg <- aggregate(mpg$cty, by=list(mpg$manufacturer), FUN=mean)  # aggregate  colnames(cty_mpg) <- c("make", "mileage")  # change column names  cty_mpg <- cty_mpg[order(cty_mpg$mileage), ]  # sort  cty_mpg$make <- factor(cty_mpg$make, levels = cty_mpg$make)  # Plot  ggplot(cty_mpg, aes(x=make, y=mileage)) +    geom_segment(aes(x=make,                     xend=make,                     y=0,                     yend=mileage), color = "#C3CED6") +    geom_point(size=3, color = "#C3CED6") +    labs(title="Lollipop Chart",         subtitle="Make Vs Avg. Mileage",         caption="source: mpg") +    HohgantR::thememineral() +    theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle=65, vjust=0.6))   # }
